page.title: 04Tegsnose Country Park
page.content: Tegsnose Country Park is above the village of Langley.I think it looks like a sheep's nose,and teg is said to be a local name for a sheep. Part of Tegsnose has been cut away because it was quarried by the Wettons until 1920 There are two ways that I can get to Tegsnose. I can walk through Tegsnose Wood or by car which can be parked in the large carparks.You can buy books,refreshments and given help by the National Park Ranger who is usually there.It has good views from the top of all Cheshire and many visitors come from far away. There are not many trees on Tegsnose but there are lots of birds,plants and flowers and people come to pick wild fruits.A stone building is there and in it you can see how the stone was quarried long ago.
